transcript_chunks.text: kirby in the forgotten land is so dope i'm giving it a five out of five kirby's first true 3d adventure is a captivating blend of mario 3d world's hyper creative platforming the addicting gameplay loop of wanting to upgrade every single ability like in ratcheting clank ripped apart and the epic grandiose soundtrack and scale of the mario galaxy series however it's very much its own thing and that thing is weird like those kingdom hearts trailers with just music and no sound effects weird but leaning hard into that weird energy combined with the juxtaposition of the poppy colors and adorable world kirby is known for being mixed with post-apocalyptic abandoned malls from the 90s somehow adds up to a really fun gaming experience with a ton of unique gimmicks that never outstay their fun there's a mouthful more of in-depth thoughts for you to hear on the new episode of the kind of funny games cast so i'll leave you with this i've never truly loved a chord kirby game but the switch era

a mouthful more of in-depth thoughts for you to hear on the new episode of the kind of funny games cast so i'll leave you with this i've never truly loved a chord kirby game but the switch era continues to redefine nintendo's iconic franchises and i'm stoked and surprised to say that
